title: South-West monsoon establishes over the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that the South-West monsoon has established over the island.

title: Sri Lanka losing revenue from low tax on used vehicle imports, CoPF calls for Customs clarification
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (CoPF) has raised concerns over potential revenue losses arising from inconsistencies in tax collection on imported motor vehicles, particularly used and short-distance driven units.

title: British soldiers make Everest history using new method
byline: Four British former special forces soldiers have set a record by climbing Mount Everest in under five days without acclimatising on the mountain, as part of a high-speed expedition controversially aided by xenon gas.

title: Wealthy foreigners able to register for Trump’s $5 million ‘gold card’ visa within a week
byline: Foreign nationals with $5 million to spare will soon be able to register for a new “gold card” visa that would give them the right to live and work permanently in the United States, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Wednesday.

title: Puwarasamkulam OIC arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Puwarasamkulam Police Station in Vavuniya has been arrested for soliciting a bribe of Rs. 500,000, the Bribery Commission has confirmed.

title: Three suspects arrested in connection with shooting of LG Election candidate in Kalutara
byline: Three individuals have been apprehended in connection with a shooting incident in Kalutara involving a candidate who contested at this year’s Local Government (LG) elections for the Kalutara Municipal Council.

title: Member of Irish rap band Kneecap charged with terrorism offence
byline: A member of the Irish rap band Kneecap was charged with a terrorism offence for displaying a flag in support of the Iran-backed group Hezbollah, British police said on Wednesday.

title: One dead, 50,000 stranded in eastern Australia floods
byline: Torrential rain continued to lash eastern Australia on Thursday (May 22), swelling already engorged rivers, engulfing roads and leaving almost 50,000 people stranded.

title: Two suspects arrested with smuggled cigarettes in Mannar
byline: Two individuals, who were transporting a total of 168,000 sticks of smuggled foreign-made cigarettes that were brought into the country without paying necessary duties, have been arrested in Oluthuduwai, Mannar.

title: Sri Lanka’s Central Bank further reduces Overnight Policy Rate
byline: The Monetary Policy Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has decided to reduce the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) by 25 bps to 7.75% at its meeting held on Wednesday (21), thereby easing monetary policy further.

title: Famous Apple designer Sir Jony Ive joins OpenAI
byline: Legendary British designer Sir Jony Ive, who helped create the Apple iPhone, is joining forces with OpenAI, as the artificial intelligence (AI) firm sets its sights on developing hardware.

title: Political parties and ind. groups requested once again to provide details of elected LG members
byline: All political parties and independent groups have been requested once again to promptly provide details of all elected members for local government bodies based on the results of the recently concluded election.

title: Mahaweli Authority Unit Manager arrested for soliciting bribe of Rs. 20,000
byline: A unit manager of the Mahaweli Authority, who solicited a bribe of Rs. 20,000, has been arrested on bribery charges.

title: Two Israeli embassy staffers killed in Washington shooting, suspect held
byline: Two Israeli embassy staff were killed in a shooting outside an event at the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington, DC, on Wednesday night, and a suspect is in custody, according to officials and media reports.

title: Oral public consultations on electricity tariffs to begin tomorrow
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) says that it will begin accepting oral public comments on the second electricity tariff revision proposed by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) for 2025, starting tomorrow (May 23).

title: Sri Lanka marks 53 years since becoming a Republic
byline: Today marks the 53rd Republic Day of Sri Lanka. Sri Lanka became a Republic on May 22, 1972, following the adoption of a new Constitution.

title: Miss England withdraws from Miss World 2025
byline: Miss England Milla Magee from Newquay has been forced to withdraw from the Miss World competition for ‘personal health reasons,’ writes Adam Dutton from SWNS.

title: Lawyer arrested for allegedly sending sexually explicit messages to High Court judge
byline: A lawyer has been arrested for allegedly sending explicit messages via Messenger to a High Court judge.

title: Indian plane makes safe landing in Srinagar despite significant damage during hailstorm
byline: An Indian passenger jet that encountered a hailstorm mid-flight and left passengers terrified, made a safe landing, despite significant damage to the plane.

title: Four arrested with ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 70mn at BIA
byline: Four Sri Lankans have been arrested by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle a stock of ‘Kush’ cannabis with a street value of over Rs. 70 million.

title: Humanitarian aid shipment from Sri Lanka reaches Myanmar
byline: The earthquake relief humanitarian aid donation shipment from Sri Lanka has reached Myanmar, the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Yangon said in a statement.

title: 11 Indian fishermen released by Sri Lanka return home
byline: A total of 11 Indian fishermen, who were arrested by the Sri Lankan Coast Guard earlier this year have returned to Tamil Nadu on Wednesday night (22).

title: Sri Lanka, Tamil Nadu trade revives as India’s Shipping Directorate eases foul weather norm
byline: India’s Directorate General of Shipping, in a circular dated May 19, relaxed foul weather norms for the operation of Mechanised Sailing Vessels (MSV), or thonies, between Thoothukudi and Sri Lanka, which would allow trade operations throughout the year.

title: UNP announces selection criteria to name LG members
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has decided to consider only the percentage of votes received by each candidate when naming UNP representatives to local government bodies.

title: Sakvithi Ranasinghe and wife given suspended sentence after pleading guilty
byline: English language tutor Chandana Veerakumara, popularly known as Sakvithi Ranasinghe and his wife, who were accused of operating an unauthorized financial institution and exploiting its deposits worth over Rs. 164 million obtained from the public, have been handed suspended sentences by the Colombo High Court.

title: Two suspects arrested with 101kg of heroin in Weeraketiya
byline: Police say the stock of narcotics taken into custody along with two suspects in Weeraketiya has been confirmed to be 101.47 kilograms of heroin.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur at several places in the Eastern and the Uva provinces and in the Hambantota and Polonnaruwa districts, the Department of Meteorology warns.

title: MP Lakmali Hemachandra named chair of Economic Development Oversight Committee
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Attorney-at-Law Lakmali Hemachandra has been appointed as the Chairperson of the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Economic Development and International Relations.

title: India’s 76 pct population is at high risk of extreme heat: study
byline: Seventy-six percent of the population in India is at a very high risk of extreme heat, a latest study conducted by New Delhi-based Council on Energy, Environment and Water said.

title: Puwarasamkulam OIC remanded over bribery charge
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Puwarasamkulam Police Station in Vavuniya, who was arrested and produced before the court on charges of soliciting a bribe, has been remanded until 27 May.

title: Sri Lanka looks to modernize and digitize driving license for overseas use
byline: A discussion has been held on the challenges Sri Lankan citizens face in using their driving licenses overseas—especially in Italy and other European countries—under the framework of the Vienna Convention on Road Traffic.

title: BOC and NSB record historic profits, annual reports handed over to President
byline: The Bank of Ceylon (BOC) and the National Savings Bank (NSB) reported record-breaking profits for the year 2024, officially presenting their annual reports to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat today (22).

title: Salt shipment from India delayed due to bad weather
byline: The arrival of the imported salt shipment may be delayed by a few more days due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, the state-run National Salt Company said.

title: Ex-CID officer who aided Harak Kata’s escape bid remanded until trial ends
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered the remand of Ravindu Sandeepa, a former Police Constable attached to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), until the conclusion of the trial.

title: Notice issued on ‘Post-Retirement Declaration’ of assets and liabilities
byline: Under the provisions of the Anti-Corruption Act, No. 9 of 2023, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) acts as the central authority for the declaration of assets and liabilities under Part II of the Act.

title: Govt committed to protecting religious and cultural heritage – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya states that the government is committed to safeguarding religious and cultural heritage.

title: Petition filed by Sri Lankan cricketers: Further consideration deferred to 28 May
byline: The Court of Appeal has scheduled further consideration for 28 May the petition filed requesting an order to nullify the decision taken by the Inland Revenue Department to impose withholding tax on national cricketers who have signed contracts with Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC), treating them as employees of the institution.
